question.body: The nodal branch of the right coronary artery supplies oxygen and nutrients to the sinoatrial node (SA node). If this artery becomes blocked by atherosclerotic plaque, such that the cells of the SA node die, what will happen to the automaticity and the rhythmicity of the heart?

multiple_choice.choice: The heart will continue to exhibit automaticity, but not rhythmicity.
The heart will no longer exhibit automaticity or rhythmicity.
The heart will no longer exhibit automaticity, but will exhibit rhythmicity.
The heart will continue to exhibit both automaticity and rhythmicity.

response.feedback: Incorrect. In this example, the heart will either have both or neither.
Incorrect. The heart has a backup system in place to make sure these are not lost.
Incorrect. In this example, the heart will either have both or neither.

Correct. The AV node will take over the repeated spontaneous depolarization, such that both properties of the heart will be maintained. The rhythmicity will occur at a slower rate than if the SA node was still pacing the heart.

part.hint: Consider the situation of overdrive suppression.
